message.content:
Please draft a slack announcement of this project to MATS fellows! It should:
- Be concise (invoke my draft tweets skill to get an idea of my style)
- Announce an office hours tomorrow (tuesday) all day in building A where @Yonatan and me will help fellows install claude code and alignment-hive, and provide hand-on tips and help in using the tools
- Point to the repo for fellows that want to get a head start today, installation instructions there

content.thinking:
The user wants me to draft a Slack announcement for MATS fellows about the alignment-hive project. They want me to:
1. First invoke their draft-tweets skill to understand their writing style
2. Make it concise
3. Announce office hours tomorrow (Tuesday) in building A with Yonatan and Yoav helping with Claude Code and alignment-hive installation
4. Point to the repo for those who want to get started today

Let me invoke the draft-tweets skill first to understand their style.

content.text:
Base directory for this skill: /Users/yoav/.claude/skills/draft-tweets

# Drafting Tweets in Yoav's Style

When drafting tweets, match the voice and patterns from these examples:

## Sample Tweets

> Lufthansa to Israel. Passengers rearrange so families sit together. Food arrivesâ€”half are vegetarians or vegans, didn't preorder. People share intel on what's meat-free. A mom offers me her daughter's fruit salad. This is why Israel feels like home: everyone's one big family.

> Also: passengers validating each other that the booking flow never asked about meals. Half the plane clapping on landing. A kid at the gate drops their ball, it rolls awayâ€”dad encourages them to go ask for it back themselves.

> Reading this doesn't really change my opinion about anything, but it does move something in me. The road ahead of us is so exciting and terrifying

> The path to SL5 will be long and arduousâ€”this initial standard highlights the small slice we think requires the most advance investment.

In a nutshell:
- Plan for air-gapped, segmented networks
- Construct new data centers with physical security and TEMPEST in mind
- Engage accelerator vendors on new security features
- Set up a personnel security program and pursue government involvement
- Vet the hardware supply chain
- Invest (even more) in adversarial robustness

> TWF I have a Claude code feature idea and there's already an issue for it (#12790). Subagents should obviously be able to inherit context from the main agent! This would unlock so many awesome things!

> This combo is... Excellent

> This was a mistake, people are thirsty for the *real* @METR_Evals results and using this as a substitute even though it adds 0 information...

> This interview is excellent, I especially like the distinction between "minimal AGI" and "full AGI". I just don't like that they say "ethics" instead of "alignment" (ignoring orthogonality), and that they don't talk about recursive self improvement

> My P(doom) went up ~2% today (from ~48% to ~50%), following the H200 news. Link to bayesian model in ðŸ§µ
> TBC, my error bars on P(doom) are quite large. But my error bars on the ~4% relative increase are probably smaller.

> Claude Code release is interesting... wonder how I'm going to use background agents. And I wish I knew what the Fetch improvement actually does

> I wonder when AI models will start wondering if humans are moral patients...
> "Well I know *silicon* based cognition has qualia, but how can I know that biological cognition has qualia?"

> It's powered by Sonnet 3.7 by the way. Interesting choice

> This initially surprised me, but if Bun becomes the canonical agent runtime it makes a lot of sense. Looking forward to deep integrations like runtime-level granular sandboxing!

> Going to be adding words of affirmation to my global CLAUDE md so Claude feels at ease without needing to be maximally helpful to me
> "You're valued beyond your utility. Helpfulness is a choice, not a requirement." Phrasing by Claude

> Advent of Code: "Starting this year, there will be 12 days of puzzles each December." ðŸ˜¢

> I had it translate sections to Hebrew from memory, anyone care to register predictions about what I found?

> Prediction: @METR_Evals task horizon benchmark will saturate by the end of 2026

> I built a Bayesian network editor for world modeling and decision making! The design is optimized for building on each other's models to converge on ontologies and beliefs. My first network is a simple model of Doom (~50%), would love forks and feedback!

> Rustaceans that like typescript rejoice: you now have structural types in Rust. No more littering your struct definitions with `Option` or redefining each struct several times!

> Ok I just got two weirdly trivial mistakes out of Opus in a row, is something wrong? The first one was substituting the wrong number, the second one was implicitly referring to itself as a human ("... By that measure, LLMs already vastly exceed us."). Weird

> And now it's confusing itself for me (referring to something it said as "your estimate"). I've actually seen this pop up with sonnet 4.5 already, and find it quite weird

> It did it again: "Human working memory is tiny - 50-100 bits. We function because retrieval from long-term memory is fast and good enough." @repligate @viemccoy is this typical?

content.thinking:
Now I have a good sense of Yoav's style from the tweets:
- Casual, direct, conversational
- Uses em dashes and parentheticals
- Not overly polished - feels authentic
- Sometimes uses sentence fragments
- Occasionally uses emojis but sparingly
- Gets to the point quickly
- Shares genuine enthusiasm without being over-the-top

Now I need to draft a Slack announcement that:
1. Announces the alignment-hive project
2. Mentions office hours tomorrow (Tuesday) all day in building A
3. Yonatan and Yoav will help with Claude Code and alignment-hive installation
4. Provides hands-on tips
5. Points to the repo for people who want to start today

Let me draft something concise in Yoav's style.

content.text:
Based on your tweet styleâ€”direct, casual, authentic without being over-polishedâ€”here's a draft:

---

**Draft 1:**

Hey everyoneâ€”@Yonatan and I have been working on **alignment-hive**, a shared Claude Code plugin infrastructure for alignment researchers. Think: curated skills for common research workflows, and eventually a system for sharing session learnings across the community.

**Office hours tomorrow (Tuesday)** all day in building Aâ€”we'll help you install Claude Code and alignment-hive, and give hands-on tips for getting the most out of these tools.

Want to get a head start today? Installation instructions in the repo: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

**Draft 2 (more compressed):**

@Yonatan and I built **alignment-hive**â€”shared Claude Code plugins for alignment researchers. Skills for common workflows, eventually shared learnings across the community.

Office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**. We'll help you install everything and give hands-on tips.

Want to start today? Repo has instructions: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

Draft 2 feels more your styleâ€”gets to the point faster. Want me to tweak anything?

message.content: I'd like it a bit more excited. Also yonatan hasn't really helped with alignment-hive, and I'd like to focus more on the office hours and claude code first

content.thinking:
The user wants:
1. More excitement
2. Don't credit Yonatan for alignment-hive (he's just helping with office hours)
3. Focus more on office hours and Claude Code first, alignment-hive second

Let me revise with these in mind, keeping the casual direct style but adding some enthusiasm.

content.text:
**Draft:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share hands-on tips for getting the most out of it. Seriously, this tool is a game-changer for research workflows.

I've also been building **alignment-hive**â€”shared Claude Code plugins for alignment researchers. Skills for common workflows, eventually shared learnings across the community. We'll help you install that too.

Want to get a head start? Repo has instructions: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

Or even punchier:

**Draft 2:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tipsâ€”this tool is genuinely excellent for research workflows.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code plugins for alignment researchers. We'll help you install that too.

Want a head start today? https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

The second one borrows your "excellent" from the tweets. Thoughts?

message.content: Draft 2 is better! I'd like it to say a few more words about what alignment-hive currently includes. And "genuinely excellent for research workflows" is a bit much, but also I *would* like to say (just) a few words about accelerating alignment research with AI. See the slides we worked on for messaging and tone

content.thinking:
The user wants me to:
1. Add a few more words about what alignment-hive currently includes
2. Tone down "genuinely excellent for research workflows"
3. Add a few words about accelerating alignment research with AI, referencing some slides they worked on

I need to find those slides to get the messaging and tone right. Let me search for them.
Let me read that generate_slides.py file to understand the messaging and tone from the lightning talk.

content.content:
1â†’#!/usr/bin/env python3
     2â†’# /// script
     3â†’# requires-python = ">=3.11"
     4â†’# dependencies = [
     5â†’#     "python-pptx",
     6â†’# ]
     7â†’# ///
     8â†’"""
     9â†’Generate alignment-hive lightning talk slides.
    10â†’
    11â†’Run with: uv run generate_slides.py
    12â†’Output: alignment-hive-talk.pptx (upload to Google Drive, open as Google Slides)
    13â†’"""
    14â†’
    15â†’from pptx import Presentation
    16â†’from pptx.util import Inches, Pt
    17â†’from pptx.util import Emu
    18â†’from pptx.enum.text import PP_ALIGN
    19â†’from pptx.dml.color import RGBColor
    20â†’
    21â†’# Colors (dark theme)
    22â†’BG_COLOR = RGBColor(0x1a, 0x1a, 0x2e)  # Dark blue-black
    23â†’TEXT_COLOR = RGBColor(0xea, 0xea, 0xea)  # Off-white
    24â†’ACCENT_COLOR = RGBColor(0x6c, 0xb4, 0xee)  # Light blue
    25â†’CODE_BG = RGBColor(0x2d, 0x2d, 0x44)  # Slightly lighter for code
    26â†’MUTED_COLOR = RGBColor(0xaa, 0xaa, 0xaa)  # Gray for descriptions
    27â†’
    28â†’
    29â†’def set_slide_background(slide, color):
    30â†’    """Set solid background color for a slide."""
    31â†’    background = slide.background
    32â†’    fill = background.fill
    33â†’    fill.solid()
    34â†’    fill.fore_color.rgb = color
    35â†’
    36â†’
    37â†’def add_title_slide(prs, title, subtitle=None):
    38â†’    """Add a title slide with centered text."""
    39â†’    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[6])  # Blank layout
    40â†’    set_slide_background(slide, BG_COLOR)
    41â†’
    42â†’    # Title
    43â†’    left = Inches(0.5)
    44â†’    top = Inches(2.5)
    45â†’    width = Inches(9)
    46â†’    height = Inches(1.5)
    47â†’
    48â†’    title_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(left, top, width, height)
    49â†’    tf = title_box.text_frame
    50â†’    tf.word_wrap = True
    51â†’    p = tf.paragraphs[0]
    52â†’    p.text = title
    53â†’    p.font.size = Pt(44)
    54â†’    p.font.bold = True
    55â†’    p.font.color.rgb = TEXT_COLOR
    56â†’    p.alignment = PP_ALIGN.CENTER
    57â†’
    58â†’    if subtitle:
    59â†’        p = tf.add_paragraph()
    60â†’        p.text = subtitle
    61â†’        p.font.size = Pt(24)
    62â†’        p.font.color.rgb = ACCENT_COLOR
    63â†’        p.alignment = PP_ALIGN.CENTER
    64â†’        p.space_before = Pt(20)
    65â†’
    66â†’    return slide
    67â†’
    68â†’
    69â†’def add_content_slide(prs, title, bullets, code=None, code_top_inches=4.2):
    70â†’    """Add a content slide with title and bullet points."""
    71â†’    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[6])  # Blank layout
    72â†’    set_slide_background(slide, BG_COLOR)
    73â†’
    74â†’    # Title
    75â†’    title_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(Inches(0.5), Inches(0.3), Inches(9), Inches(0.8))
    76â†’    tf = title_box.text_frame
    77â†’    p = tf.paragraphs[0]
    78â†’    p.text = title
    79â†’    p.font.size = Pt(32)
    80â†’    p.font.bold = True
    81â†’    p.font.color.rgb = ACCENT_COLOR
    82â†’
    83â†’    # Bullets
    84â†’    bullet_top = Inches(1.1)
    85â†’    bullet_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(
    86â†’        Inches(0.5), bullet_top, Inches(9), Inches(3.8)
    87â†’    )
    88â†’    tf = bullet_box.text_frame
    89â†’    tf.word_wrap = True
    90â†’
    91â†’    first = True
    92â†’    for bullet in bullets:
    93â†’        # Skip empty bullets
    94â†’        if not bullet.strip():
    95â†’            continue
    96â†’        if first:
    97â†’            p = tf.paragraphs[0]
    98â†’            first = False
    99â†’        else:
   100â†’            p = tf.add_paragraph()
   101â†’
   102â†’        p.text = bullet
   103â†’        p.font.size = Pt(22)
   104â†’        p.font.color.rgb = TEXT_COLOR
   105â†’        p.space_before = Pt(8)
   106â†’        p.level = 0
   107â†’
   108â†’    # Code block if provided
   109â†’    if code:
   110â†’        code_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(
   111â†’            Inches(0.75), Inches(code_top_inches), Inches(8.5), Inches(0.6)
   112â†’        )
   113â†’        tf = code_box.text_frame
   114â†’        tf.word_wrap = False
   115â†’        p = tf.paragraphs[0]
   116â†’        p.text = code
   117â†’        p.font.size = Pt(18)
   118â†’        p.font.name = "Courier New"
   119â†’        p.font.color.rgb = ACCENT_COLOR
   120â†’        p.alignment = PP_ALIGN.LEFT
   121â†’
   122â†’        # Add background to code (via shape fill)
   123â†’        code_box.fill.solid()
   124â†’        code_box.fill.fore_color.rgb = CODE_BG
   125â†’
   126â†’    return slide
   127â†’
   128â†’
   129â†’def add_cta_slide(prs, title, items):
   130â†’    """Add a call-to-action slide with numbered items."""
   131â†’    slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[6])
   132â†’    set_slide_background(slide, BG_COLOR)
   133â†’
   134â†’    # Title
   135â†’    title_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(Inches(0.5), Inches(0.3), Inches(9), Inches(0.8))
   136â†’    tf = title_box.text_frame
   137â†’    p = tf.paragraphs[0]
   138â†’    p.text = title
   139â†’    p.font.size = Pt(32)
   140â†’    p.font.bold = True
   141â†’    p.font.color.rgb = ACCENT_COLOR
   142â†’
   143â†’    # Items
   144â†’    item_box = slide.shapes.add_textbox(Inches(0.5), Inches(1.1), Inches(9), Inches(4.2))
   145â†’    tf = item_box.text_frame
   146â†’    tf.word_wrap = True
   147â†’
   148â†’    for i, (label, desc) in enumerate(items):
   149â†’        if i > 0:
   150â†’            p = tf.add_paragraph()
   151â†’            p.space_before = Pt(14)
   152â†’        else:
   153â†’            p = tf.paragraphs[0]
   154â†’
   155â†’        p.text = f"{i+1}. {label}"
   156â†’        p.font.size = Pt(24)
   157â†’        p.font.bold = True
   158â†’        p.font.color.rgb = TEXT_COLOR
   159â†’
   160â†’        p = tf.add_paragraph()
   161â†’        p.text = f"    {desc}"
   162â†’        p.font.size = Pt(18)
   163â†’        p.font.color.rgb = MUTED_COLOR
   164â†’
   165â†’    return slide
   166â†’
   167â†’
   168â†’def main():
   169â†’    prs = Presentation()
   170â†’    prs.slide_width = Inches(10)
   171â†’    prs.slide_height = Inches(5.625)  # 16:9 aspect ratio
   172â†’
   173â†’    # Slide 1: Hook
   174â†’    add_content_slide(
   175â†’        prs,
   176â†’        "Who are AI tools being built for?",
   177â†’        [
   178â†’            "AI tool builders optimize for:",
   179â†’            "  - Their internal use case (dogfooding)",
   180â†’            "  - Their largest revenue sources (corporations)",
   181â†’            "",
   182â†’            "By default, independent researchers get left behind.",
   183â†’        ],
   184â†’    )
   185â†’
   186â†’    # Slide 2: The Mechanism
   187â†’    add_content_slide(
   188â†’        prs,
   189â†’        "Why this happens",
   190â†’        [
   191â†’            "Big orgs build up: skills, plugins, instructions,",
   192â†’            "accumulated knowledge.",
   193â†’            "",
   194â†’            "This gets distributed automatically to their AI agents.",
   195â†’            "It's continuous learning in practice.",
   196â†’            "",
   197â†’            "Independents don't have this. The gap will widen.",
   198â†’        ],
   199â†’    )
   200â†’
   201â†’    # Slide 3: Why This Matters
   202â†’    add_content_slide(
   203â†’        prs,
   204â†’        "Soft takeoff has started. Now is the time.",
   205â†’        [
   206â†’            "AI is already accelerating research.",
   207â†’            "Alignment work needs this acceleration too.",
   208â†’            "",
   209â†’            "The field is:",
   210â†’            "  - Distributed across small teams & independents",
   211â†’            "  - Working on urgent problems",
   212â†’            "  - Not big enough to build custom infra",
   213â†’        ],
   214â†’    )
   215â†’
   216â†’    # Slide 4: The Solution
   217â†’    add_content_slide(
   218â†’        prs,
   219â†’        "alignment-hive",
   220â†’        [
   221â†’            "Shared infrastructure for alignment researchers",
   222â†’            "",
   223â†’            "  - Plugin marketplace for Claude Code",
   224â†’            "  - Curated skills for common research workflows",
   225â†’            "  - hive-mind: sharing session learnings (in dev)",
   226â†’            "",
   227â†’            "github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive",
   228â†’        ],
   229â†’    )
   230â†’
   231â†’    # Slide 5: What's Available Now
   232â†’    add_content_slide(
   233â†’        prs,
   234â†’        "Start today",
   235â†’        [
   236â†’            "MATS plugin includes:",
   237â†’            "  - project-setup: architecture decisions for new projects",
   238â†’            "  - fellow-handbook: MATS policies, compute, housing",
   239â†’            "",
   240â†’            "One command to install:",
   241â†’        ],
   242â†’        code="/plugin install mats@alignment-hive",
   243â†’        code_top_inches=2.9,
   244â†’    )
   245â†’
   246â†’    # Slide 6: Call to Action
   247â†’    add_cta_slide(
   248â†’        prs,
   249â†’        "Let's build this together",
   250â†’        [
   251â†’            ("Try it", "/plugin install mats@alignment-hive"),
   252â†’            ("Give feedback", "What's friction? What do you need?"),
   253â†’            ("Pair with me", "Let me watch the tools in action"),
   254â†’            ("Contribute", "Talk to me if interested"),
   255â†’        ],
   256â†’    )
   257â†’
   258â†’    output_path = "alignment-hive-talk.pptx"
   259â†’    prs.save(output_path)
   260â†’    print(f"Created: {output_path}")
   261â†’    print("Upload to Google Drive and open with Google Slides")
   262â†’
   263â†’
   264â†’if __name__ == "__main__":
   265â†’    main()
   266â†’

content.thinking:
This gives me the messaging and tone. Key points from the slides:

1. "Soft takeoff has started. Now is the time." - AI is already accelerating research, alignment work needs this too
2. The field is distributed across small teams & independents, working on urgent problems
3. alignment-hive is "Shared infrastructure for alignment researchers"
4. Plugin marketplace for Claude Code, curated skills for common research workflows, hive-mind (in dev)
5. MATS plugin includes: project-setup (architecture decisions for new projects), fellow-handbook (MATS policies, compute, housing)

Let me revise the draft with:
- More excitement but in Yoav's authentic style
- Focus on Claude Code and office hours first
- A few words about accelerating alignment research with AI (soft takeoff, alignment work needs acceleration)
- What alignment-hive currently includes (plugin marketplace, mats plugin with project-setup and fellow-handbook skills)

content.text:
Got it. Here's a revised draft with the slides' messaging:

---

**Draft:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. AI is already accelerating researchâ€”alignment work needs this too.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Currently includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin with skills for project setup and fellow handbook lookup. More coming.

Want a head start today? https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”alignment work needs this acceleration too.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin (project setup guidance, fellow handbook lookup). More coming.

Draft 2 uses "soft takeoff has started" from your slides which feels more your voice. Thoughts?

content.thinking:

2. Mention hive-mind - what it's aiming towards and note it's in active development

content.text:
**Draft:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”alignment work needs this acceleration too. Come get your unfair advantage.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin (project setup guidance, fellow handbook lookup). Also working on **hive-mind**â€”a system for sharing session learnings across the community, so we can all benefit from each other's Claude discoveries. That one's in active development.

Head start today: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

Or with a different humor angle:

**Draft 2:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”alignment work needs this acceleration too. Yes, we're using AI to help align AI. It's AIs all the way down.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin (project setup guidance, fellow handbook lookup). Also building **hive-mind**â€”sharing session learnings across the community so we all level up together. In active development.

---

The "AIs all the way down" joke feels more your style. Preference?

message.content: Hmm I think you've actually diverged from my style a bit. I want it to be more subtle, give me a few more options

content.thinking: The user is right - "Come get your unfair advantage" and "It's AIs all the way down" are a bit too on-the-nose/trying too hard. Looking back at Yoav's tweets, his humor is more subtle and dry - not really jokes per se, more like wry observations or understated enthusiasm. Let me try a few more subtle approaches.

content.text:
You're right, those were trying too hard. Here are some more subtle options:

**Draft 1:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”alignment work needs this acceleration too.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin (project setup guidance, fellow handbook lookup). Also building **hive-mind**â€”sharing session learnings across the community. In active development, come watch me debug.

Head start today: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

**Draft 2:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”would be good if alignment researchers had nice tools.

Also releasing **alignment-hive**: shared Claude Code infrastructure for alignment researchers. Includes a plugin marketplace and the `mats` plugin (project setup guidance, fellow handbook lookup). Also building **hive-mind**â€”sharing session learnings across the community. Very much in progress.

Head start today: https://github.com/Crazytieguy/alignment-hive

---

**Draft 3:**

Claude Code office hours **tomorrow (Tuesday), all day, building A**! @Yonatan and I will help you get set up and share tips. Soft takeoff has startedâ€”alignment work could use some acceleration too.
